revised_title: Fluctuating Asymmetry in Sexual Ornament Size and Flight Performance
tldr: The author's study on sexual ornament size and fluctuating asymmetry in the swallow's tail found that long-tailed males with less asymmetry had better flight performance. Female swallows may use fluctuating asymmetry in male ornaments as a reliable cue for male quality. The cost of fluctuating asymmetry in tail size affects maneuverability during flight, suggesting that asymmetry and inherent differences between individuals impact flight performance.
